comments.body:
My method was wrong.
I also thought you pointed out correctly.
I fixed the code.
Thank you.

Presumably this would become a union of other artifact location types? Just checked [the docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/codepipeline/latest/APIReference/API_ArtifactLocation.html), and it does only have the `S3` type, weird. As is it's a little confusing, could maybe use a comment for whoever follows up.

These names are a little generic maybe? I'd prefer `CodePipelineArtifact` etc, but I'm not sure what the `S3Artifact*` stuff should be named.
`Credentials` is fine, as it's a generic type (and I'm suprised we don't already have it)
[Artifact](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/codepipeline/latest/APIReference/API_Artifact.html) docs mark all these properties as optional? I don't know how that works.
I'll leave the names of the types as is -- they do actually line up with the API reference.  I've left them as mandatory, as I always saw them provided.
The docs were a little confusing here, so just to be clear, it's possible that this is not provided by cloudfront, e.g. that your handler should test if this is set before reading it?
I'm also not 100% sure but I will check for some more API specifications and comment back.

Just noticed these inconsistent `| null` here. Gross, as all these properties are all certainly going to be one of not present or `null` if they even are optional.
That said, not your problem!
I assume those are always set?
I bet that this file should be named `handler` not `hander`.
Be aware this will make you be notified of all PRs modifying this package.
I know. That's the reason I added that line.
üëç welcome to the team then!
Just to check: you are aware this means you will be pinged for every PR on this package going forward?
yes I am - that's what community is about :)
üëç
Just to check you're OK with getting contacted for every PR on this package?
Yeah, that's fine
